name: Private tender package
highlight_answers:
{"category": "Administrative Questions", "subcategory": "Eligibility & Compliance", "question": "What are the documents required to be submitted before submission deadline? List all of them and indicate how to prepare these docs.", "answer": "**Documents that must be supplied in the tender before the submission deadline** | # | Document | How to prepare it | Reference | |---|----------|-------------------|-----------| | 1 | **European Single Procurement Document (ESPD)** – Parts II–IV must be completed and signed.
• If the tenderer is a group, each legal entity must fill a separate ESPD.
• Use the ESPD template that is part of the procurement documents.
• Check that all information in Parts II–IV is accurate, sign the document, and attach it to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:9](chunkref://9) | | 2 | **Notification of processing of personal data** – a signed statement that explains how the tenderer will process personal data.
• Use the template supplied in the procurement documents.
• Sign the statement and include it in the tender package. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:14](chunkref://14) | | 3 | **Statement concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions (Article 5k)** – a declaration that the tenderer has no Russian involvement.
• Use the template provided.
• Sign the statement and attach it to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:14](chunkref://14) | | 4 | **Statement of joint participation** – required only if the tenderer participates together with other entities.
• Use the joint‑participation template.
• Declare the joint participation, sign, and attach it to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:9](chunkref://9) | | 5 | **Statement of support** – required only if the tenderer is asked to provide a statement of support.
• Use the supplied template, sign, and attach it to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:14](chunkref://14) | | 6 | **Completed Tender Form Sheet (Appendix 5)** – the technical price sheet that must be filled out with the technical price and other mandatory fields.
• Enter the technical price, check all required fields, sign, and attach it to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:7](chunkref://7) | | 7 | **Description of the tenderer’s project organisation** – a written description of the organisation, its structure and relevant experience.
• Prepare a concise narrative, sign, and attach it to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:7](chunkref://7) | | 8 | **CVs of key personnel** – curriculum vitae for every key person listed in the tender.
• Provide the CVs in English, sign, and attach them to the tender. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:7](chunkref://7) | | 9 | **Consultancy service agreements (up to 5)** – the tenderer must provide details of up to five most recent consultancy agreements as part of the ESPD.
• Prepare a separate document that lists each agreement with name, date, scope, value, and other required details.
• Only the five most recent agreements are considered. | [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:13](chunkref://13) | **General preparation & submission rules** * All documents must be in **English**. If a document is originally in another language, provide an English translation. [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:7](chunkref://7) * The tender must be **submitted electronically via the Dalux Tender platform**. Test the submission before the deadline to ensure the package is accepted. [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:7](chunkref://7) * Every signed document must be attached to the tender package and must be **signed by an authorised representative** of the tenderer. [Tender Conditions.pdf, p:6](chunkref://6) These documents constitute the complete tender package that must be submitted before the deadline.", "references": [{"chunk_id": 9, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 9, "bbox": [0.20415879017013233, 0.1683046683046683, 0.9829867674858224, 0.8624078624078624], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — submit questions if they identify provisions in the procurement documents which prevent them from submitting tenders without reservations or prerequisites. The contracting entity may not award the contract to any tenderer based on a tender with reservations relating to the following:  essential elements of the tender material, or  non-essential elements of the tender material if the contracting entity cannot fix the price of the reservations without sufficient certainty Tender validity period Tenders must remain valid and open for acceptance by the contracting entity for 3 months from the time limit for receipt of the tender. Tenderers are released from their tenders at the following:  the expiry of the tender validity period,  the cancellation of the procurement procedure, or  the publication of a contract award notice (but not at the notification of award decision). Opening of tenders Tenders will be opened after the time limit for tenders. Tenderers will not be entitled to attend the opening. 4.6 European Single Procurement Document(s) Every tenderer must fill out the ESPD as part of their tender. If the tenderer consists of more than one legal entity a separate ESPD must be filled out by each legal entity of the tenderer. The following explains how the different parts of the ESPD form must be filled out by the candidate requesting to participate in the tender procedure. 4.6.1 Part I: Information concerning the procurement procedure and the contracting authority or contracting entity In Part I the tenderer is not required to fill in any information. 4.6.2 Part II: Information concerning the participating candidate In Part II.A the tenderer must fill in all parts concerning the identification of the legal entity. The tenderer must answer whether it is a Micro, a Small or a Medium-Sized Enterprise. The tenderer is not required to answer whether it:  is a sheltered workshop, a social business or if it will provide for the performance of the contract in the context of sheltered employment programmes,", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [529.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 14, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 14, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.85995085995086], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — Canada (Yukon, Northwest Territories, Nunavut), and the United States (Alaska)) within the past 10 years. The minimum requirements can be fulfilled in one consultancy service agreement or in separate consultancy service agreements. The tenderer is not required to answer whether the information regarding any of the selection criteria is available at no cost to the authorities from an EU Member State database. 4.6.4 Part VI: Concluding statements In Part IV the tenderer must provide the date and place of the completion of the European Single Procurement Document, by which the tenderer:  formally declares that the information stated under Parts II-IV is accurate and correct and that it has been set out in full awareness of the consequences of serious misrepresentation,  formally declares to be able, upon request and without delay, to provide documentary evidence of the information that has been provided in Part III and Part IV, and  formally consents to the contracting entity, gaining access to documents supporting the information, which has been provided in Part III and Part IV for this procurement procedure. 4.7 Processing of personal data The contracting entity will ensure that processing of personal data provided by a participating candidate during the pre-qualification phase will be carried out in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Greenlandic Personal Data Act (decree no. 1238 of 14 October 2016). In connection with the submission of tender, personal data will be collected and processed within the meaning of the personal data legislation, as the tender will contain information about the tenderer’s contact persons as well as contact persons listed in the references submitted in the tender. To ensure that persons, who are subject to the contracting entity’s processing of information, are notified thereof, the tenderer are obliged to provide all persons, whose personal data are included in a tender, with the information stated in the notification of processing of personal data. The tenderer must include a signed version of the notification in tender. 4.8 Statements 4.8.1 Statement concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine The tenderer must submit a statement to declare that there is no Russian involvement, cf. Article 5k(1) of Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 of 31 July 2014 concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine, in relation to a tender from the participating candidate. The tenderer is encouraged to use the template in the procurement documents.", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [527.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 14, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 14, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.85995085995086], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — Canada (Yukon, Northwest Territories, Nunavut), and the United States (Alaska)) within the past 10 years. The minimum requirements can be fulfilled in one consultancy service agreement or in separate consultancy service agreements. The tenderer is not required to answer whether the information regarding any of the selection criteria is available at no cost to the authorities from an EU Member State database. 4.6.4 Part VI: Concluding statements In Part IV the tenderer must provide the date and place of the completion of the European Single Procurement Document, by which the tenderer:  formally declares that the information stated under Parts II-IV is accurate and correct and that it has been set out in full awareness of the consequences of serious misrepresentation,  formally declares to be able, upon request and without delay, to provide documentary evidence of the information that has been provided in Part III and Part IV, and  formally consents to the contracting entity, gaining access to documents supporting the information, which has been provided in Part III and Part IV for this procurement procedure. 4.7 Processing of personal data The contracting entity will ensure that processing of personal data provided by a participating candidate during the pre-qualification phase will be carried out in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Greenlandic Personal Data Act (decree no. 1238 of 14 October 2016). The tenderer is encouraged to use the template in the procurement documents.", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [527.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 7, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 7, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.8488943488943489], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — 3.6 Confidentiality The participating candidates shall observe unconditional confidentiality regarding any information of a confidential nature that may come to their knowledge in connection with the procurement procedure, including, but notwithstanding, the procurements documents. Therefore, the participating candidates must withhold all such confidential information from unauthorized persons regarding matters which may arise from their knowledge of this procurement procedure. 4 Submission of tenders 4.1 Electronic submission Any tender must be submitted electronically via Dalux Tender and cannot be submitted by any other means. Participating candidates are encouraged to test the submission process in Dalux Tender well in advance of the time limit for receipt of tenders. The contracting entity will only have access to the tenders after the time limit for tenders. 4.2 Time limit The tender must be submitted no later than 28 October 2025 at 12:00 UTC+1. A tender cannot be submitted after the expiry of the time limit. 4.3 Language The tender must be submitted in English. 4.4 Content of tender Tenders must contain the following:  European Single Procurement Document(s) (ESPD), cf. clause 4.9, below including documentation on the information given in the ESPD, cf. clause 6 below.  Notification of processing of personal data, cf. clause 4.10 below  Statement regarding Article 5k of Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 of 31 July 2014 concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine, cf. clause 4.11.1 below  Statement of joint participation (if relevant), cf. clause 4.11.2 below  Statement(s) of support (if relevant), cf. clause 4.11.3 below  Completed Tender Form Sheet Appendix 5  Description of the tenderer´s project organisation for the Project  CVs for the tenderer´s following key personal:", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [527.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 7, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 7, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.8488943488943489], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — 3.6 Confidentiality The participating candidates shall observe unconditional confidentiality regarding any information of a confidential nature that may come to their knowledge in connection with the procurement procedure, including, but notwithstanding, the procurements documents. Therefore, the participating candidates must withhold all such confidential information from unauthorized persons regarding matters which may arise from their knowledge of this procurement procedure. 4 Submission of tenders 4.1 Electronic submission Any tender must be submitted electronically via Dalux Tender and cannot be submitted by any other means. Participating candidates are encouraged to test the submission process in Dalux Tender well in advance of the time limit for receipt of tenders. The contracting entity will only have access to the tenders after the time limit for tenders. 4.2 Time limit The tender must be submitted no later than 28 October 2025 at 12:00 UTC+1. A tender cannot be submitted after the expiry of the time limit. 4.3 Language The tender must be submitted in English. 4.4 Content of tender Tenders must contain the following:  European Single Procurement Document(s) (ESPD), cf. clause 4.9, below including documentation on the information given in the ESPD, cf. clause 6 below.  Notification of processing of personal data, cf. clause 4.10 below  Statement regarding Article 5k of Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 of 31 July 2014 concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine, cf. clause 4.11.1 below  Statement of joint participation (if relevant), cf. clause 4.11.2 below  Statement(s) of support (if relevant), cf. clause 4.11.3 below  Completed Tender Form Sheet Appendix 5  Description of the tenderer´s project organisation for the Project  CVs for the tenderer´s following key personal:", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [527.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 7, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 7, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.8488943488943489], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — 3.6 Confidentiality The participating candidates shall observe unconditional confidentiality regarding any information of a confidential nature that may come to their knowledge in connection with the procurement procedure, including, but notwithstanding, the procurements documents. Therefore, the participating candidates must withhold all such confidential information from unauthorized persons regarding matters which may arise from their knowledge of this procurement procedure. 4 Submission of tenders 4.1 Electronic submission Any tender must be submitted electronically via Dalux Tender and cannot be submitted by any other means. Participating candidates are encouraged to test the submission process in Dalux Tender well in advance of the time limit for receipt of tenders. When the tenderer participates together with others, cf. Part II.A, or relies on the economic and financial capacities of other entities, cf. Part II.C, the contracting entity will calculate the total amounts of the involved entities which must fulfil the minimum requirements (e.g., the contracting entity will calculate the solvency ratio based on the total equity and total assets of all relevant entities). In Part IV.C the tenderer must state maximum 5 performed consultancy service agreements comparable with the tendered Consultancy Service Agreement where the performed services must have been completed within the past 10 years. The description of the services can be made in separate document to the ESPD, where every description must not exceed two A4 pages. When the tenderer participates together with others, cf. Part II.A, or relies on the technical and professional capacities of other entities, cf. Part II.C, the number of consultancy service agreements is calculated based on the total number from all relevant entities. If a tenderer has listed more than 5 consultancy service agreements, the contracting entity will only read and assess the 5 most recent service agreements (first based on end date, and then based on start date). Each listed consultancy service agreement must include the following information:  ‘Description’, the tenderer must specify the performed services, including whether specific parts were performed by subconsultants engaged by the tenderer,  ’Amount’, the tenderer must state the contract sum that the tenderer has received for the performance of the services,  ‘Start date’, the tenderer must state when the consultancy service agreement was entered into,  ‘End date’, the tenderer must state when the consultancy service agreement was completed, and  ‘Recipient’, the tenderer must state the name of the client and contact information for the client’s project manager or contact person. The tenderer is encouraged to describe the performed consultancy service agreements with as much detail as possible and how they are relevant in relation to the minimum requirements below. The tenderer is required to have performed minimum the following (minimum requirements):  one consultancy agreement regarding consultancy in connection with construction and civil engineering works for the establishment of a hydroelectric power plant within the last 10 years, and  one consultancy service agreement regarding consultancy in connection with construction and civil engineering works in Greenland or in the Arctic (e.g., in Iceland, Finland (Northern Ostrobothnia, Kainuu and Lappi), Sweden (Västerbotten, Norrbotten and Lappland), Norway (Nordland, Troms, Finnmark, Svalbard and Jan Mayen),", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [530.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 7, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 7, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.8488943488943489], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — 3.6 Confidentiality The participating candidates shall observe unconditional confidentiality regarding any information of a confidential nature that may come to their knowledge in connection with the procurement procedure, including, but notwithstanding, the procurements documents. Therefore, the participating candidates must withhold all such confidential information from unauthorized persons regarding matters which may arise from their knowledge of this procurement procedure. 4 Submission of tenders 4.1 Electronic submission Any tender must be submitted electronically via Dalux Tender and cannot be submitted by any other means. Participating candidates are encouraged to test the submission process in Dalux Tender well in advance of the time limit for receipt of tenders. The contracting entity will only have access to the tenders after the time limit for tenders. 4.2 Time limit The tender must be submitted no later than 28 October 2025 at 12:00 UTC+1. A tender cannot be submitted after the expiry of the time limit. 4.3 Language The tender must be submitted in English. 4.4 Content of tender Tenders must contain the following:  European Single Procurement Document(s) (ESPD), cf. clause 4.9, below including documentation on the information given in the ESPD, cf. clause 6 below.  Notification of processing of personal data, cf. clause 4.10 below  Statement regarding Article 5k of Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 of 31 July 2014 concerning restrictive measures in view of Russia’s actions destabilising the situation in Ukraine, cf. clause 4.11.1 below  Statement of joint participation (if relevant), cf. clause 4.11.2 below  Statement(s) of support (if relevant), cf. clause 4.11.3 below  Completed Tender Form Sheet Appendix 5  Description of the tenderer´s project organisation for the Project  CVs for the tenderer´s following key personal:", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa9846", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [527.0, 814.0], "tender_id": "8a566c42-130f-47ef-a4aa-e1fa98461198"}, {"chunk_id": 7, "file_name": "Tender Conditions.pdf", "page": 7, "bbox": [0.2049335863377609, 0.1683046683046683, 0.98292220113852, 0.8488943488943489], "snippet": "Tender Conditions — 3.6 Confidentiality The participating candidates shall observe unconditional confidentiality regarding any information of a confidential nature that may come to their knowledge in connection with the procurement procedure, including, but notwithstanding, the procurements documents. project_card_fields.bid bond:
Based on the provided **Tender Conditions** document, **there is no mention of a mandatory bid bond**.

### Key Points from the Document:
- The document outlines various **financial and economic standing requirements**, such as:
  - Audited annual reports, bank statements, or certified accountant statements.
  - Minimum financial thresholds (e.g., economic and financial standing criteria in Part IV.B).
- It specifies that **documentation must be no older than 3 months** prior to the submission deadline.
- However, **no reference is made to a bid bond, performance bond, or any form of guarantee** required at the time of tender submission.

### Conclusion:
> ❌ **No, there is no mandatory bid bond** required according to the provided tender conditions.  
> The evaluation focuses on **price, quality, qualifications, and experience**, with no indication of a bond being required.

If you are unsure, it is still advisable to confirm with the contracting authority via the **Dalux Tender platform**, especially if this is a high-value or public procurement process, as some jurisdictions may require bonds even if not explicitly stated.
project_card_fields.evaluationMethod:
The proposals will be evaluated using a **mixed evaluation method**, combining **price and quality** (also known as **"lowest price technically acceptable"** or **"best value"** approach), with **quality being a decisive factor**.

### Key Points on Evaluation Method:

1. **Mixed Evaluation (Price + Quality):**
   - The evaluation is **not based solely on the lowest price**.
   - Instead, it uses a **combined assessment** of **price** and **quality of the proposal**, with **quality playing a significant and decisive role** in the decision-making process.

2. **Quality-Based Assessment (Weighted Criteria):**
   - The evaluation is structured around **specific quality criteria** outlined in the **Tender Conditions**, particularly in **Section 7.3**:
     - **Subcriterion 7.3.1: Organizational Structure & Project Management**  
       → Focus on the effectiveness, robustness, and accessibility of the tenderer’s core and project organization.
     - **Subcriterion 7.3.2: Qualifications and Experience of Personnel**  
       → Evaluation of CVs and documented experience of key personnel (project manager, design managers, quality manager, etc.) in relevant areas such as hydropower plants, client consultancy, and major civil engineering projects.
     - **Subcriterion 7.3.3: Technical Assistance & Quality Assurance**  
       → Assessment of quality assurance processes, systems, and resources, with positive weight given to well-defined and effective systems.

3. **Positive Weighting for Quality Factors:**
   - The contracting entity explicitly states that it will **attach positive weight** to:
     - Effective and functional core organization.
     - Consistent use of key personnel.
     - Accessibility of key personnel.
     - Robust project organization with diverse, qualified staff.
     - Demonstrated experience in hydropower (especially bored penstocks, tunnel works) and client consultancy.
     - Well-defined quality assurance processes.

4. **Price Evaluation (Appendix 5 – Tender Form Sheet):**
   - While price is considered, it is **not the sole determinant**.
   - The **Tender Form Sheet (Appendix 5)** will be used to collect pricing information.
   - However, **a low price alone will not guarantee award** if the quality of the proposal is insufficient.

5. **No Automatic Award to Lowest Bidder:**
   - The contracting entity **explicitly states** that it will **not award the contract based on a tender with reservations** unless the price can be fixed with certainty.
   - This implies that **technical and quality shortcomings** can disqualify even the lowest-priced bid.

6. **Standstill Period:**
   - After the award decision is notified, a **10-day standstill period** applies, during which the contract cannot be signed. This allows for challenges and ensures transparency.

---

### Summary:

> ✅ **Evaluation Method:** **Mixed (price + quality)**  
> ✅ **Primary Focus:** **Quality of the proposal**, especially organizational capability, personnel qualifications, and technical systems  
> ❌ **Not:** Lowest price only  
> ✅ **Outcome:** The **best overall value** (not just cheapest) will be selected, based on a **weighted assessment** of quality and price.

This approach ensures that the selected consultant has the **technical competence, experience, and organizational strength** needed for a complex, high-stakes project like a hydropower plant in remote Greenland.
